column5: Wow .... nice specks ... phenomenal ....naturals or stocked ?
thanks guys,  Mr Spiel you're in, and we'll make an exception for Bunk. Jeff, the big lakes were wide open, I didn't drive by Cedar but I'm guessing that would be a little dicey.  Stockers Julian
Nice looking fish Chrises! lol Those are a couple big bruisers, thanks for sharing guys
Mr Spiel you're in   Awesome!
Nice winter fishing trip. My compliments on their release.
Wow. Very impressive.
Sweet fish! Awesome
thanks Matt, that young guy knows what he's doing
Wow now thats a couple of nice brookies through the ice! Congrats on a banner day (very jealous here...)
I keep coming back here to admire Chris the Younger's fish, Very Impressive.
THAT'S A HUGE AZZ TROUT!  Note to self   >Must borrow co-workers work shirt with the name tag Chris on it.
If I changed my name to Chris would you take me with you?? Pretty please!!
A great start to your season!
Wicked!!  I am trying to plan my first trout outing for Jan 3 or 4th.  Posts like this make me eager!!
Great report guys. Kinda reminds me years ago snowmobiling into the park for Specks.
nice going Chris and young Chris!  I'm off Wed if your passing by and want to head out again, just saying...  LOL!
Couple of bruiser brookies! Well done guys. I'm off all winter if you want a fishing pal
cool report thanks for posting, glad you guys did well

There's a small appendix in the fishing regs. It gives the gps coordinates for a small lake, and a special regulation that only people with the first name Chris are allowed to fish the lake. Very bizarre. So away we go...   We took off some layers and bushwacked into Chris Lake.     Just so Ironmaker doesn't give us heck , we took some safety precautions. I take the axe and start working my way out, checking as I go.      We each had a long rope. We had a towel, dry clothes and waterproof matches in a dry bag, just in case.   These little guys kept us busy, banging into our set lines, pretty frequently.      I was first to set the bar a little higher.      We had some interesting conversations.  Chris- "Did you know I have only 2 toes on my left foot" Chris-`That`s awesome! What happened?" Chris- "Muskie, Chemong Lake"   Chris- "I just tried to pass gas but it may not have been all gas" Chris- "I didn't really want to know that"   Chris- "Have you ever seen a sasquatch?" Chris- "Yes, I can communicate with them vocally and by tree knocking"     Chris gets a light bite and the battle is on.      Titanic brookie, big fish of the day.     A fun day, all fish released.
howah!  nice!!!  thanks for the report, pretty funny too ?
Killing it.    Ya gotta love how Eagar to feed first ice trout are.
You weren't kidding when you said you got some nice fish, wow!
wow...those are huge for such a small pond.
Wow! Man, this is what I get for saying I'm going to pass on a day of fishing.
NICE fish! Funny little read too, thanks for the chuckle.
Great day Chris & Chris !!
Good lord!  Is that where the hatchery dumps their brood stock?
Never heard of Chris Lake. LOL
Ok, that's it, I'm changing my name to Chris. haha  Nice fish boys!  S.
Nice brookies def gotta try and get out. How were the lakes looking in that area? Cheers jeff
My name is "Chris,"  I says  while drooling all over myself.....  Nice outing guys! Very envious.
YES!!  That 'Chris Lake' is a good one.  Some real beauty fish there.  Good job there Chris and Chris
Thats some purty fish there fellas.  Nice.
Wow some great fish there Chrises. I'm starting to get a Chris complex.
nice fish!
It's a good thing you guys didn't come to North Bay this weekend.... I don't think we would have found brookies like that!
Way to go guys some nice looking brookies
Dang doods!  Chris Lake it is!!!  Do fellow Bravo drivers get a day pass? lol.   Seriously nice specks.  Great early season outing Chris... and Chris.
WOW
Looks like a great early season outing . Way to go guys
Great looking brookies, I'm drooling!
Was that lake at the end of a rainbow or something??   Nice fish!   Thanks for sharing.

Specs through the ice still on my bucket list so I'm green with envy right now. Good job guys and thx for sharing.  Kudos on releasing them all too. I grew up fishing creek specs and love the little buggers in the frying pan. Would have been difficult for me not to keep a few little ones.
